topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 2.0: Removing Ceph Monitor Node

body.p: The process to remove Ceph monitor nodes, depends on how they have been deployed - either on the controller node or on a separate/dedicated resource node.

section.title: To Remove Monitor Nodes from the Controller Node
section.p:
Permanent removal of a monitor is not supported when the monitor service is installed on the controller node. However, to temporarily bring down the service on the controller node (for maintenance purposes), perform the following steps:
Login to the Deployer/lifecycle-manager node.
Stop the monitor service running on the specific host by running the following commands:cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts ceph-stop.yml --limit <mon-node-to-remove>Replace the string <mon-node-to-remove> in above command with the monitor host to be removed from cluster (for example, stratushelion-ccp-c1-m1-mgmt).
Remove the monitor service from the cluster:ceph mon remove <ceph-mon-host>

section.title: Remove Monitor Nodes from a Separate/Dedicated Node
section.p:
Perform the following steps to remove a monitor node from a separate/dedicated node.
Login to the monitor node to be removed.
Stop the monitor service running on the specific host by running the following commands :service ceph-mon@<ceph-mon-host> stop
Remove the monitor service:ceph mon remove <ceph-mon-host>
Login to the deployer/lifecycle-manager node.
Edit the servers.yml file and remove the host section from the file.vim ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/servers.yml
Commit your configuration:cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "Remove monitor node <host-name>"Replace the string <host-name> in the above commit message with the actual host name.
Run the configuration processor:ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml
Use the playbook below to create a deployment directory: ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
